member.name: T:Id3Lib.FrameHelper
member.summary: Manage the Parsing or Creation of binary frames.
member.remarks: The FrameHelper is a helper class that recives binary frame from a ID3v1 tag and returns the correct parsed frame or form a frame creates a binary frame that can be saved on an ID3v2 tag in a mp3 file.

member.name: M:Id3Lib.FrameHelper.Build(System.String,System.UInt16,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Create a frame depending on the tag form its binary representation.

member.name: M:Id3Lib.FrameHelper.Make(Id3Lib.IFrame)
member.summary: Build a binary data frame form the frame object.

member.name: T:Id3Lib.TagNotFoundException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the tag is missing.

member.name: T:Id3Lib.Sync
member.summary: Provides static methods for making ID3v2 unsynchronisation
member.remarks:
This helper class takes care of the synchronisation and unsynchronisation needs. The purpose of unsynchronisation is to make the ID3v2 tag as compatible as possible with existing software and hardware.
Synchsafe integers are integers that keep its highest byte bit (bit 7) zeroed, making seven bits out of every eight available.

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.Unsafe(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a syncsafe integer to a normal integer

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.Safe(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a normal integer to a syncsafe integer

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.UnsafeBigEndian(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a syncsafe integer to a normal integer

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.SafeBigEndian(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a syncsafe integer to a normal integer

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.Unsafe(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convert a syncsafe stream to a normal stream
member.returns: Number of bytes removed form the original stream

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Sync.Safe(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convert from an unsafe or normal stream to a syncsafe stream
member.returns: Number of bytes added to the original stream

members.member:
Get the track genre.
no-one could have been using alternative spelling "Genere" as the original code returned the TALB frame anyway!

member.name: P:Id3Lib.TagHandler.Disc
member.remarks: The 'Part of a set' frame is a numeric string that describes which part of a set the audio came from. This frame is used if the source described in the "TALB" frame is divided into several mediums, e.g. a double CD. The value MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of parts in the set. E.g. "1/2".

member.name: P:Id3Lib.TagHandler.Length
member.summary: Get the length. the length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.TagHandler.Lyrics
member.summary: Get the lyrics. (technically: Unsychronised lyrics/text transcription)

member.name: P:Id3Lib.TagHandler.Picture
member.summary: Get/Set the associated picture as System.Drawing.Image, or null reference

member.name: P:Id3Lib.TagHandler.PictureData
member.summary: Get/Set the associated picture as byte[], or null reference

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.Flags
member.summary: Get or set the ID3v2 Frame flags

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.TagAlter
member.summary: Get or set the tag alter flag
member.remarks: This flag tells the tag parser what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the tag is altered in any way. the frames.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.FileAlter
member.summary: Get or set the file alter flag
member.remarks: This flag tells the tag parser what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the file, excluding the tag, is altered.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.ReadOnly
member.summary: Get or set the read only flag
member.remarks: This flag, if set, tells the software that the contents of this frame are intended to be read only.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.Grouping
member.summary: Get or set the grouping flag
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not this frame belongs in a group with other frames.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.Compression
member.summary: Get or set the compression flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not the frame is compressed.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.Encryption
member.summary: Get or set the encryption flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not the frame is encrypted.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.Unsynchronisation
member.summary: Get or set the unsynchronisation flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not unsynchronisation was applied to this frame.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FlagHandler.DataLength
member.summary: Get or set the data length.
member.remarks: This flag indicates that a data length indicator has been added to the frame.

member.summary: The exception is thrown when a frame is corrupt.

member.name: T:Id3Lib.InvalidStructureException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when some component of an mp3 file is permanently corrupt. Re-reading the file will always give you the same error, as opposed to I/O or permission errors that can be usefully retried.
member.remarks: "Exceptions should be marked [Serializable]" http://www.codeproject.com/KB/architecture/exceptionbestpractices.aspx#Exceptionsshouldbemarked[Serializable]22

member.name: T:Id3Lib.FrameText
member.remarks:
The FrameText class handles the frames of text information these are often the most important frames, containing information like artist, album and more. There may only be one text information frame of its kind in an tag.
Text encoding $xx Information text string(s) according to encoding

member.name: T:Id3Lib.FrameManager
member.summary: Handle the loading and saving of ID3 tags.

member.summary: Load the ID3v2 frames to a binary stream
member.param: Bynary stream holding the ID3 Tag
member.returns: Model keeping the ID3 Tag structure

member.name: M:Id3Lib.FrameManager.SeekEndOfPadding(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: find the first non-zero character in the stream then back up one, so it will be the first char that gets read and the stream position is pointing to the start of the non-zero (e.g. audio) data

member.name: T:Id3Lib.FrameModel
member.summary: Manages an ID3v2 tag as an object reprsentation.
member.remarks: The FrameModel class represents a ID3v2 tag, it contains a that handles the tag header, an that it is optional and stores the frames.

member.name: M:Id3Lib.FrameModel.UpdateSize
member.summary: predict the size of the frames on disk (without any padding) by streaming the tag to a dummy stream, which updates the stored size.
member.remarks: Although the the padding is streamed out, the size isn't added on to Header.TagSize

member.name: M:Id3Lib.FrameModel.CalculateCRC
member.summary: calculate the CRC-32 of the frames by streaming them to a buffer and checksumming that.
member.remarks: this doesn't checksum the padding area, as rewriting the file with different padding changes neither the body of the tag, nor the body of the audio.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.FrameModel.IsValidId3v2
member.summary: id3v2 tags can not have "no frames"

member.name: T:Id3Lib.Header
member.remarks: The Header class manages the first part of the ID3v2 tag that is the first ten bytes of the ID3v1 tag.

member.name: M:Id3Lib.Header.SerializeFooter(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Save corresponding footer into the stream.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.HeaderSize
member.summary: Get the size of the header only.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Version
member.summary: Get or set ID3v2 major version number.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Revision
member.summary: Get or set the ID3v2 revision number.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.TagSize
member.summary: Get or set the ID3v2 frames size, i.e. the tag excluding header and footer.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.TagSizeWithHeaderFooter
member.summary: Get the minimum complete ID3v2 tag size, including header and footer but not including any padding.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Unsync
member.summary: Get or set if unsynchronisation is applied on all frames.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.ExtendedHeader
member.summary: Get or set if the header is followed by an extended header.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Experimental
member.summary: Get or set if the tag is experimental stage.
member.remarks: This flag shall always be set when the tag is in an experimental stage.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Footer
member.summary: Get or set if a footer is present at the end of the tag.
member.remarks: Can't be uesd simultaneously with the frame padding they are mutualy exlusive.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.Padding
member.summary: Get if padding is applied on the tag.
member.remarks: Can't be used simultaneously with the frame footer they are mutualy exlusive.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.Header.PaddingSize
member.summary: Get or set the padding size, and thus padding.

member.name: T:Id3Lib.InvalidPaddingException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the amount of padding doesn't match the space left over at the end of the ID3V2 tag.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.InvalidPaddingException.Measured
member.summary: the number of zero bytes actually found between the last frame in the id3v2 tag, and the first non-zero byte of audio.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.InvalidPaddingException.Specified
member.summary: the amount of space between the last frame in the id3v2 tag, and the specified end of the tag block.

member.name: P:Id3Lib.InvalidPaddingException.Message
member.summary: overrides default message with a specific "Padding is corrupt" one
